sentence.Network_en: Mirella approached him and, after a brief hesitation, shook his hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 米雷拉走近他，犹豫片刻后，和他握了握手。

sentence.Network_en: The board said it had no hesitation in unanimously rejecting the offer.

sentence.Network_en: Referee Michael Reed had no hesitation in awarding a penalty.
sentence.Network_cn: 裁判迈克尔·里德毫不犹豫地判了点球。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin haesitatio(n)-, from haesitare (see hesitate)

entry.def: Hesitation is an unwillingness to do something, or a delay in doing it, because you are uncertain, worried, or embarrassed about it.

example.ex: He promised there would be no more hesitations in pursuing reforms.
example.tran: 他答应在推进改革这件事上不再迟疑不决。

example.ex: ...the prime minister's hesitation to accept a ceasefire.
example.tran: 首相在接受停火协议上的犹豫

entry.def: If you say that you have no hesitation in doing something, you are emphasizing that you will do it immediately or willingly because you are certain that it is the right thing to do.

example.ex: The board said it had no hesitation in unanimously rejecting the offer...
example.tran: 董事会自称毫不犹豫地一致否决了该项报价。

example.ex: Some of us had careers, but we had no hesitation in giving them up to work alongside our wives.
example.tran: 我们中间有些人有自己的事业，但我们毫不犹豫地选择了放弃自己的事业，和我们的妻子并肩工作。

entry.tran: 毫不犹豫地;心甘情愿地
entry.def: If you say that someone does something without hesitation, you are emphasizing that they do it immediately and willingly.

example.ex: The great majority of players would, of course, sign the contract without hesitation...
example.tran: 绝大多数球员当然会毫不犹豫地签合同。
男孩毫不犹豫地跟了上去。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粘性物质[如粘胶],带粘性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad增加+hes粘附+ive……的→adj.&n.粘性物质[如粘胶],带粘性的
ad增加+hes粘附+ion表名词→n.支持,粘着
hesitate[v.犹豫,踌躇;含糊,支吾]+ion表名词→n.犹豫, 踌躇
hes粘附+itate→粘粘糊糊→犹豫不决

means.word_mean: 犹豫, 踌躇, 不愿

sentences.en: She agreed without the slightest hesitation.
His doubts and hesitations were tiresome.
sentences.cn: 他的疑惑和犹豫令人厌烦。
